member.name: T:Relativity.Services.ObjectQuery.IObjectQueryManager
member.summary: IObjectQueryManager interface enables querying for Relativity workspace and admin artifacts.

member.name: M:Relativity.Services.ObjectQuery.IObjectQueryManager.QueryAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32,Relativity.Services.ObjectQuery.Query,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.String)
member.summary: Query Relativity Workspace or Admin Artifacts.
member.param: Workspace ID of the workspace which contains the intended artifacts to query for. Pass -1 for admin artifacts.
ArtifactTypeId for the artifacts to be queried
Instance of a Query object which describes the conditions, sorts, and artifact's Fields to be returned in the returned QueryResultSet's results.
Indicates the requested index of the first artifact in the returned QueryResultSet
Indiates the number of items requested of the query result, starting with index provided by the start parameter.
IDs of permissions to be included per item result.

Optional query token to be used to look up a previously run query. If this parameter is supplied, and the corrosponding cached query exists, the query parameter will be ignored and the results will be pulled directly from the already cached query result.

member.name: T:Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.MassUpdateByCriteriaRequest
member.summary: Represents a request to perform a mass update operation on all objects that meet a specified set of conditions.
member.remarks: The MassUpdateByCriteriaRequest class specifies the view or search conditions used to select a list of objects with the same type for updating. It also specifies same value for a specific field that is to be updated on the objects. In the Relativity UI, this update operation is equivalent to the user selecting the All option in the mass operations bar on a list page.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.MassUpdateByCriteriaRequest.FieldValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the fields and values used for updating each object. The same value is used for updating a specific field on each object.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.MassUpdateByCriteriaRequest.ObjectIdentificationCriteria
member.summary: Gets or sets specific view or search conditions used to select the objects for updating.

member.name: T:Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.MassUpdatePerObjectsRequest
member.summary: Represents a request to perform a mass update operation on a list of objects by modifying each of the specified object fields with a distinct value.
member.remarks: The MassUpdatePerObjectsRequest class specifies identifiers for a list of objects of the same type for updating. It also specifies a distinct value for each object field that is to be updated. This action is like overlay behavior available through the Relativity Desktop Client (RDC).

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.MassUpdatePerObjectsRequest.Fields
member.summary: Gets or sets a list fields for updating on the specified objects.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.MassUpdatePerObjectsRequest.ObjectValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the objects and their values to be updated. The values must be specified in the same order as the fields.

member.name: T:Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.MassUpdateOptions
member.summary: Represents information about how a mass update request is performed by replacing or merging field values.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.MassUpdateOptions.UpdateBehavior
member.summary: Gets or set the behavior used when mass updating multiple choice and multiple object fields by replacing or merging values. By default, values are replaced.

member.name: T:Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.MassUpdateByObjectIdentifiersRequest
member.summary: Represents a request to perform a mass update operation on a list of objects by modifying each of the specified object fields with the same value.
member.remarks: The MassUpdateByObjectIdentifiersRequest class specifies the identifiers used to select a list of objects with the same type for updating. It also includes the same values for all object fields that are to be updated. In the Relativity UI, this update operation is equivalent to the user selecting the Checked or These option in the mass operations bar on a list page.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.MassUpdateByObjectIdentifiersRequest.Objects
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of objects to be updated.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.MassUpdateByObjectIdentifiersRequest.FieldValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the fields and values used for updating each object. The same value is used for updating all object fields that are to be updated.

member.name: T:Relativity.Services.Objects.IObjectManager
member.summary: IObjectManager interface exposes methods on the Relativity Object Manager web service used for reading and updating fields on Document objects and Relativity Dynamic Objects (RDOs), as well as querying on Relativity objects.

member.name: M:Relativity.Services.Objects.IObjectManager.QueryAsync(System.Int32,Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.QueryRequest,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches for Workspaces, Documents, RDOs, and system types.
member.param: Workspace ID of the workspace containing the artifacts to query for. Pass -1 for admin artifacts.
A QueryRequest object containing conditions, sorting order, fields, and other information for the query.
Index of the first artifact in the returned QueryResultSet object.
Number of items to return in the query result, starting with index in the start parameter.
member.returns: Returns the results of the executed query, or a subset of a previously run (cached) query referenced by a specified query token.
member.remarks: The QueryAsync() methods supports querying for the following system types: Application, Batch, Batch Sets, Choice, Client, Group, Markup Set, User, Object Type, Tab, Folder, Layout, View, Workspace, Error, Field, Relativity Script, and Saved Search.

member.name: M:Relativity.Services.Objects.IObjectManager.QueryAsync(System.Int32,Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.QueryRequest,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IProgress{Relativity.Services.DataContracts.DTOs.ProgressReport})
member.summary: Searches for Workspaces, Documents, RDOs, and system types, and reports the query execution progress.
member.param: Workspace ID of the workspace containing the artifacts to query for. Pass -1 for admin artifacts.
A QueryRequest object containing conditions, sorting order, fields, and other information for the query.
Index of the first artifact in the returned QueryResultSet object.
Number of items to return in the query result, starting with index in the start parameter.
Contains a callback that reports query execution progress.

member.name: M:Relativity.Services.Objects.IObjectManager.QueryAsync(System.Int32,Relativity.Services.Objects.DataContracts.QueryRequest,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.IProgress{Relativity.Services.DataContracts.DTOs.ProgressReport})
member.summary: Searches for Workspaces, Documents, RDOs, and system types, reports the query execution progress, and provides a token used for canceling the query.
member.param: Workspace ID of the workspace containing the artifacts to query for. Pass -1 for admin artifacts.
A QueryRequest object containing conditions, sorting order, fields, and other information for the query.
Index of the first artifact in the returned QueryResultSet object.
Number of items to return in the query result, starting with index in the start parameter.
Used to request the cancellation of the object query.
Contains a callback that reports query execution progress.
member.returns: Returns the results of the executed query, or a subset of a previously run (cached) query referenced by a specified query token.
member.remarks: The QueryAsync() methods supports querying for the following system types: Application, Batch, Batch Sets, Choice, Client, Group, Markup Set, User, Object Type, Tab, Folder, Layout, View, Workspace, Error, Field, Relativity Script, and Saved Search.

member.name: M:Relativity.Services.FieldMapping.IFieldMapping.GetAllMappedFieldsAsync(System.Int32,System.Guid[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a list of mapped Relativity fields.
member.param: The workspace artifact identifier.

An optional list of GUIDs corresponding to Relativity fields, which have field data returned for them regardless of whether they are mapped to a data source. Only Invariant currently uses this field. For general use, send in the empty set ([]) for this parameter.

The Artifact ID of the processing data source used to populate the mapped fields. Note: Set this value only if you want an audit of the mapped fields added to the corresponding data source in Relativity. In all other cases, pass the integer 0 as the parameter.

member.summary: The name of the field as it is displayed in Relativity.

member.summary: A flag indicating whether a field is enabled for Data Grid. This flag is only valid for text fields.

member.summary: The name of the field

member.summary: The name of the external data source (i.e. Invariant).

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.FieldMapping.ExternalMapping.FriendlyName
member.summary: The "user-friendly" name of the source field.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.FieldMapping.ExternalMapping.UseUnicodeEncoding
member.summary: Indicates the field uses Unicode encoding.
member.remarks: This only applies to text fields, and a text field can only be mapped if this value is true.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.FieldMapping.ExternalMapping.CatalogLength
member.summary: The maximum length for a fixed-length Catalog Field
member.remarks: This will only be populated for members of the Field Catalog.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.FieldMapping.ExternalMapping.CurrentLength
member.summary: The current maximum length of a fixed-length field in the Relativity database.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.FieldMapping.ExternalMapping.ObjectType
member.summary: Integer representing the fields object type.
member.remarks: Values correspond to the ArtifactType enumeration. Used for validation; only artifact type 10, which corresponds to the Document object, is valid for Field Mapping.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.FieldMapping.ExternalMapping.IsArtifactBaseField
member.summary: Boolean flag indicating if the field is a Base Field.
member.remarks: A Base field is a type of System field, and is not valid for Field Mapping.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.FieldMapping.ExternalMapping.FieldCategory
member.summary: The Relativity-defined category of the field.
member.remarks: Values correspond to the FieldCategory enumeration. The following categories are associated with system fields, and are therefor invalid for Field Mapping: AutoCreate, Batch, FolderName, FullText, GenericSystem, MarkupSetMarker, ParentArtifact, ProductionMarker, Reflected, MultiReflected

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.FieldMapping.ExternalMapping.AssociativeArtifactTypeID
member.summary: The Artifact Type ID an associated object
member.remarks: Values correspond to the ArtifactType enumeration. If the associated ArtifactTypeID is equal to Batch (8), the field isn't valid for Field Mapping.

member.name: T:Relativity.Services.LoggingConfig.ILoggingConfigurationManager
member.summary: Exposes methods on Logging Configuration Manager service that manipulate configurations used by the Relativity logging framework.

member.name: M:Relativity.Services.LoggingConfig.ILoggingConfigurationManager.GetAllAsync
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of all logging configurations in the EDDSLogging database.

member.name: M:Relativity.Services.LoggingConfig.ILoggingConfigurationManager.CreateAsync(Relativity.Services.LoggingConfig.Configuration)
member.summary: Creates a new configuration or updates the properties of an existing one.
member.remarks: A configuration includes settings for logging information for a Relativity environment. The Logging Configuration Manager service checks for a configuration with an ID that matches the Id property set in the object passed to the CreateAsync() method. If it finds a configuration with this ID, then the service updates it with the values set on the Configuration object. Otherwise, it uses the properties on the object to create a new logging configuration in the EDDSLogging database.

member.name: M:Relativity.Services.LoggingConfig.ILoggingConfigurationManager.DeleteAsync(Relativity.Services.LoggingConfig.Configuration)
member.summary: Deletes a logging configuration from the EDDSLogging database.
member.remarks: The DeleteAsync() method deletes the logging configuration with the ID that matches the value in the Id property on the Configuration object passed to it.

The Logging Rule Manager service checks for a rule with an ID that matches the Id property set in the object passed to the CreateAsync() method. Otherwise, it uses the properties on the object to create a new logging rule in the EDDSLogging database.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.Security.Models.PasswordProvider.MaximumPasswordHistory
member.summary: The number of passwords to remember when setting a new password. A user cannot set their password to any previous password within the defined window size. Setting this value to zero disabled password history checking.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.Security.Models.PasswordProvider.MaximumInvalidLoginAttempts
member.summary: The number of attempts a user is allowed to use before locking thier password method.

member.name: P:Relativity.Services.Security.Models.PasswordProvider.AdditionalWorkFactor
member.summary: A measure of the amount of time required to verify a password when a user logs into Relativity.
member.remarks:
The work factor determines how robust your stored passwords hashes are against brute-force attack. Increasing this number will improve the robustness of your password hashes. However, increasing the work factor by one will also double the amount of time needed to log in to Relativity. Adjusting the work factor allows you to choose the proper balance between security and usability.
The value of this setting is added to the work factor for the Relativity environment. Set this value to zero in order to use the default work factor for the Relativity environment. In most cases this will be sufficient.

member.name: M:Relativity.Services.Security.ILoginProfileManager.SetPasswordAsync(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Explicitly set a user's password. Note that admins are not allowed to reset Relativity users' passwords by default. (see Remarks for more information)
member.remarks:
By default a user can only set their own password in Relativity. Administrators are not allowed to set other users' passwords for security reasons. Relativity admins are encouraged to use the Invitation Email workflow instead of explicitly managing user passwords.
If desired, Relativity can be configured to allow administrators to directly manage user passwords. See the Relativity documentation for more information.
member.param: The user id
The new password for the user. Passwords must meet the password complexity criteria configured for this environment.
